summary: This document consists of email exchanges regarding a real estate transaction involving a couple from England interested in purchasing a property in Bradford, NH. The correspondence discusses the timeline for closing and title search, as well as warnings about potential fraud in wire transactions.

persons.name: Steve Marshal
persons.context: Steve Marshal is mentioned as one of the buyers interested in a property in Bradford, NH.

persons.name: Jen Marshal
persons.context: Jen Marshal is mentioned alongside her husband Steve as a buyer interested in a property.

persons.name: U M
persons.context: U M is a realtor who is showing the property to the Marshals and is coordinating with the attorney for the closing process.

persons.name: Attorney at Law
persons.context: An unnamed attorney is involved in the transaction, providing legal advice and handling the closing.

connections.description: Steve and Jen Marshal are a married couple looking to purchase a property.
U M is the realtor showing the property to Steve Marshal.
U M is the realtor showing the property to Jen Marshal.
The attorney is handling the legal aspects of the closing for the transaction facilitated by U M.

events.title: Real Estate Offer Submission
events.description: The offer for the property is being submitted, and discussions about the closing timeline are taking place.

keyFacts: The Marshals are interested in purchasing a property in Bradford, NH.
The correspondence discusses the possibility of a quick closing within 2-3 days.
There are warnings about potential fraud related to wire transfers in the email.
U M is coordinating the real estate transaction and has referred the Marshals to an attorney.
The attorney's office is prepared to handle the closing process.
